sentences.text: Board Meetings and Committees
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During 2016, the Board of Directors of Transocean Ltd. held four meetings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors and the committees of the Board of Directors met at least once a quarter and the quarterly meetings generally occurred over a period of two days.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each of our directors attended at least 80% of the meetings following their election, including meetings of committees on which the director served.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors has standing Audit, Compensation, Finance, Corporate Governance, and Health Safety and Environment Committees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As noted above, the charters for these committees may be found on our website at www.deepwater.com by selecting the Governance page in the Investors section dropdown.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Board of Directors may from time to time form special committees to consider particular matters that arise.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The purpose of the Compensation Committee is to assist the Board of Directors in (1) developing an appropriate compensation program and benefit package for
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) members of the Executive Management Team (as defined below),
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) persons defined as officers pursuant to section 16
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) of the Exchange Act, and (c) any other person whose compensation is required to be disclosed by applicable securities laws and regulations (collectively, the Specified Executives) and members of the Board of Directors; and (2) complying with the Board of Directors legal and regulatory requirements as to Board member and Specified Executive compensation in order to facilitate the Companys ability to attract, retain and motivate qualified individuals in a system that aligns compensation with the Companys business performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The authority and responsibilities of the Compensation Committee include, among others, the following:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: annually review and recommend to the Board of Directors for submission to and ratification by the shareholders pursuant to Swiss law and our Articles of Association the maximum aggregate amount of compensation of the Board of Directors and the Executive Management Team for the relevant period;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: annually review and approve the compensation paid to members of the Board of Directors and Specified Executives;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: select appropriate peer groups and market reference points against which the Companys Board of Directors and executive compensation is compared;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: annually recommend focus areas for our Chief Executive Officer for approval by members of our Board of Directors who meet our independence and experience requirements;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: annually review, with participation of our full Board of Directors, our Chief Executive Officers performance in light of our established focus areas;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: annually set our Chief Executive Officers compensation based, as appropriate, upon his performance evaluation together with competitive data and subject to shareholder ratification requirements pursuant to our Articles of Association and applicable law;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: administer our long-term incentives plans, Performance Award and Cash Bonus Plan, Deferred Compensation Plan, and any other compensation plans or arrangements providing for benefits primarily to members of the Board of Directors and executive officers in accordance with goals and objectives established by the Board of Directors, the terms of the plans, and any applicable rules and regulations;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: consider and make recommendations to the Board of Directors, with guidance from an outside compensation consultant, concerning the existing Board of Directors and executive compensation programs and changes to such programs;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: consider, with guidance from an outside compensation consultant, and approve the material terms of any employment, severance, termination or other similar arrangements (to the extent permitted by applicable law and our Articles of Association) that may be entered into with members of the Board of Directors and Specified Executives; provided, however, that the Compensation Committee shall not recommend and the Board of Directors shall not authorize single-trigger change of control agreements for any of our officers or directors;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: assess the risks, with the assistance of external resources as the Compensation Committee deems appropriate, of the Companys compensation arrangements applicable to members of the Board of Directors and the Specified Executives; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: retain and approve the fees of legal, accounting or other advisors, including any compensation consultant, employed by the Committee to assist it in the evaluation of executive and director compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See Compensation Discussion and Analysis for a discussion of additional responsibilities of the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee may delegate specific responsibilities to one or more individual committee members to the extent permitted by law, NYSE listing standards and the Compensation Committees governing documents.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee may delegate all or a portion of its powers and responsibilities with respect to the compensation plans and programs described above and in our Compensation Discussion and Analysis to one or more of our management committees; provided, that the Compensation Committee retains all power and responsibility with respect to awards granted to our Board members and executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Chief Executive Officer has been delegated authority to grant equity awards under the Companys  long-term incentives plans to new and existing employees of the Company, excluding executive officers and other officers above the Vice President level, provided that such awards shall not exceed U.S. $5,000,000 in grant value per calendar year in aggregate and no such individual award shall exceed U.S. $350,000 in grant value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee has delegated to a subcommittee composed of its chairman and at least one additional committee member the authority to approve interim compensation actions resulting from promotions, competitive realignment, or the hiring of new executive officers (excluding the Chief Executive Officer), including but not limited to establishing annual base salary, annual bonus targets, long-term bonus targets and the grant of equity awards, subject to any required vote of the shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee has also delegated authority to the Chief Executive Officer to, upon termination of service of an employee of the Company (excluding executive officers and other officers at or above the Senior Vice President level), accelerate vesting of awards granted under the Companys  long-term incentives plans and to extend exercisability of options for a period of up to one year, but not beyond the original exercise
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee has further delegated authority to the Chief Executive Officer to determine whether an individual is disabled and/or to set applicable criteria for making such determination for purposes of the Companys  long-term incentives plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee is notified of compensation actions made by the Chief Executive Officer or the subcommittee at the meeting following the end of each calendar quarter in which such actions are taken.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The current members of the Compensation Committee are Mr. Tan, Chairman, and Messrs. Curado, Intrieri and McNamara.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee met four times during 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Finance Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Finance Committee approves our long-term financial policies, insurance programs and investment policies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It also makes recommendations to the Board of Directors concerning the Companys dividend policy, securities repurchase actions, the issuance and terms of debt and equity securities and the establishment of bank lines of credit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Finance Committee approves the creation, termination and amendment of certain of our employee benefit programs and periodically reviews the status of these programs and the performance of the managers of the funded programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The current members of the Finance Committee are Mr. Muller, Chairman, Ms. Chang and Messrs. Barker, Intrieri and Merksamer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Finance Committee met four times during 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Corporate Governance Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Corporate Governance Committee makes recommendations to the Board of Directors with respect to the nomination of candidates for election to the Board of Directors, how the Board of Directors functions and how the Board of Directors should interact with shareholders and management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It reviews the qualifications of potential candidates for the Board of Directors, coordinates the self-evaluation of the Board of Directors and committees and proposes to the Board of Directors candidates to stand for election at the next general meeting of shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The current members of the Corporate Governance Committee are Mr. McNamara, Chairman, and Messrs. Deaton and Intrieri.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Corporate Governance Committee met four times during 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Health Safety and Environment Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Health Safety and Environment Committee assists the Board of Directors in fulfilling its responsibilities to oversee the Companys management of risk in the areas of health, safety and the environment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Health Safety and Environment Committee reviews and discusses with management the status of key environmental, health and safety issues.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, the Health Safety and Environment Committee regularly evaluates Company policies, practices and performance related to health, safety and environmental issues and guides strategy decisions to promote company goals and compliance with applicable rules and regulations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Beginning in 2013, the Health Safety and Environment Committee assumed additional responsibility to oversee the Companys implementation of certain requirements of the Consent Decree by and among the U.S. Department of Justice and certain of the Companys affiliates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Health Safety and Environment Committee has required the Company to provide, and will review, regular reports regarding compliance with all aspects of the Consent Decree.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The current members of the Health Safety and Environment Committee are Mr. Deaton, Chairman, and Messrs. Merksamer, Muller and Tan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Health Safety and Environment Committee met four times during 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Audit Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee is responsible for recommending the selection, retention and termination of our independent registered public accountants and our auditor pursuant to the Swiss Code of Obligations to the Board of Directors and to our shareholders for their approval at a general meeting of shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee is directly responsible for the compensation and oversight of our independent registered public accountants and our auditor pursuant to the Swiss Code of Obligations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee further advises as necessary in the selection of the lead audit partner.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee also monitors the integrity of our financial statements and the independence and performance of our auditors and their lead audit partner and reviews our financial reporting processes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee reviews and reports to the Board of Directors the scope and results of audits by our independent registered public accounting firm, our auditor pursuant to the Swiss Code of Obligations and our internal auditing staff and reviews the audit and other professional services rendered by the accounting firm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It also reviews with the accounting firm the adequacy of our system of internal controls.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It reviews transactions between us and our directors and officers for disclosure in the proxy statement, our policies regarding those transactions and compliance with our business ethics and conflict of interest policies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors requires that all members of the Audit Committee meet the financial literacy standard required under the NYSE rules and that at least one member qualifies as having accounting or related financial management expertise under the NYSE rules.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the SEC has adopted rules requiring that we disclose whether
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: or not the Audit Committee has an audit committee financial expert as a member.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An audit committee financial expert is defined as a person who, based on his or her experience, possesses all of the following attributes:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: an understanding of generally accepted accounting principles and financial statements;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the ability to assess the general application of such principles in connection with the accounting for estimates, accruals, and reserves;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: experience preparing, auditing, analyzing or evaluating financial statements that present a breadth of complexity of accounting issues that are generally comparable to the breadth and level of complexity of issues that can reasonably be expected to be raised by our financial statements, or experience actively supervising one or more persons engaged in such activities;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: an understanding of internal control over financial reporting; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: an understanding of audit committee functions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The person must have acquired such attributes through one or more of the following:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: education and experience as a principal financial officer, principal accounting officer, controller, public accountant or auditor or experience in one or more positions that involve the performance of similar functions;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: experience actively supervising a principal financial officer, principal accounting officer, controller, public accountant, auditor or person performing similar functions;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: experience overseeing or assessing the performance of companies or public accountants with respect to the preparation, auditing or evaluation of financial statements; or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: other relevant experience.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The current members of the Audit Committee are Mr. Barker, Chairman, Ms. Chang and Mr. Curado.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee met eight times during 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors has reviewed the criteria set by the SEC and determined that each of the current members of the Audit Committee is financially literate and qualifies as an audit committee financial expert.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Board of Directors has determined that each of the current members of the Audit Committee qualifies under NYSE rules as having accounting or related financial management expertise.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Barker is a chartered accountant, served as an audit partner in an accounting firm and served as the Vice Chairman-U.K. of PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP from 2008 to 2011.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Chang was previously partner in charge of Corporate Finance for KPMG Peat Marwick LLP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Curado served as President and Chief Executive Officer of Embraer S.A. from 2007 to 2016 and has significant risk management and compliance experience.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to Ms. Changs membership on the Audit Committee, she also serves on the audit committees of Sykes Enterprises, Incorporated, Edison International and certain funds advised by the Capital Group of Companies, Inc. and its subsidiaries.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to NYSE rules, the Board of Directors has determined that Ms. Changs service on the audit committees of such companies would not impair her ability to effectively serve on the Companys Audit Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Finally, NYSE rules restrict directors that have relationships with the Company that may interfere with the exercise of their independence from management and the Company from serving on the Audit Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that the members of the Audit Committee have no such relationships and are therefore independent for purposes of NYSE rules.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Compensation Strategy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors who are employees of the Company do not receive compensation for Board of Directors service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At present, all of the directors except Mr. Thigpen, our President and Chief Executive Officer, are non-employees and receive compensation for their service on the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We use a combination of cash and equity compensation to attract and retain qualified candidates to serve on the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors believes that any compensation method should be weighted more toward compensation in the form of equity in order to more closely align director compensation with shareholders interests.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, non-employee director compensation in U.S. dollars included the following fixed components:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual Retainernon-employee Director      100,000  Annual Retainernon-employee Vice Chairman   250,000  Annual Retainernon-employee Chairman   325,000  Additional Annual Retainer for Committee Chairmen      Audit Committee   35,000  Compensation Committee   20,000  Corporate Governance Committee, Finance Committee and Health Safety and Environment Committee   10,000  Grant of Restricted Share Unitsnon-employee Directors and Vice Chairman   210,000  Grant of Restricted Share Unitsnon-employee Chairman   325,000  (1) (2) (2)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (1)    Currently, the Company does not have any director serving in a Vice Chairman role.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (2)     Restricted share units are granted to each non-employee director and chairman annually and have an aggregate value equal to U.S. $210,000 and U.S. $325,000 respectively, based upon the average of the high and low sales prices of our shares for each of the 10 trading days immediately prior to the date of grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The restricted share units vest on the date first to occur of (1) the first anniversary of the date of grant or (2) the Annual General Meeting next following the date of grant, subject to continued service through the vesting date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Vesting of the restricted share units is not subject to any performance measures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, we pay or reimburse our directors travel and incidental expenses incurred for attending Board of Directors, committee and shareholder meetings and for other Company business-related purposes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 Director Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: AUDIT COMMITTEE REPORT
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Two primary roles of the Audit Committee are to (1) assist the Board of Directors in overseeing the key financial and compliance related matters and (2) monitor integrity of the financial statements of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While management is responsible for the Companys internal controls and the financial reporting process, in accordance with its Charter, the Audit Committee encourages continuous improvement of and fosters adherence to the Companys policies, procedures and practices at all levels.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee is also directly responsible for the appointment, compensation, retention and oversight of the independent registered public accounting firm, Ernst & Young LLP, and our auditor under the Swiss Code of Obligations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ernst & Young LLP has been the Companys independent registered public accounting firm since 1993 and is responsible for performing an independent audit of the Companys financial statements in accordance with the standards of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee considers the effectiveness of these processes and the independence of Ernst & Young LLP on an ongoing basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A full description of the Audit Committees key functions is contained in the Companys Audit Committee Charter available at: www.deepwater.com by selecting the Governance page in the Investors section dropdown.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of its oversight function for the year ended December 31, 2016, the Audit Committee:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Reviewed and discussed the audited financial statements of the Company to be included in the Annual Report with management, our internal auditors and Ernst & Young LLP;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Discussed with Ernst & Young LLP the matters required to be discussed by the Statement on Auditing Standards No. 61, as amended (AICPA, Professional Standards, Vol. 1. AU section 380), as adopted by the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board in Rule 3200T;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In accordance with the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002, which requires certifications by the Companys chief executive officer and chief financial officer in certain of the Companys filings with the SEC, discussed the review of the Companys reporting and internal controls undertaken in connection with these certifications with the Companys management and independent registered public accounting firm;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Reviewed and discussed with the Companys management and independent registered public accounting firm managements report and Ernst & Young LLPs report on internal control over financial reporting in accordance with Section 404 of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Developed quarterly meeting agendas based on input from each Committee member, Ernst & Young LLP, members of management and the Companys internal audit function;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Conducted regular meetings with our internal auditors and Ernst & Young LLP (with and without management present) to discuss the overall scope and plans for future audits, results of examinations, evaluations of internal controls and other material matters;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Reviewed all non-audit services and engagements, service quality and working relationships with Ernst & Young LLP; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Reviewed such other matters as it deemed appropriate, including other provisions of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002 and rules adopted or proposed to be adopted by the SEC and the NYS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee also has received the written disclosures and the letter from Ernst & Young LLP regarding the auditors independence pursuant to the applicable requirements of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board Ethics and Independence Rule 3526, and it has reviewed, evaluated and discussed the written disclosures with that firm and its independence from the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee further has discussed with management of the Company and the independent registered public accounting firm such other matters and received such assurances from them as it deemed appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Discussion and Analysis
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This Compensation Discussion and Analysis provides an overview and analysis of Transoceans executive compensation program and policies, material compensation decisions and the key factors we considered in making those decisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It includes specific information about the compensation paid, earned or granted to the following persons who comprise our Named Executive Officers for 2016:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Jeremy D. Thigpen, President and Chief Executive Officer
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mark L. Mey, Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: John B. Stobart, Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Office
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Howard E. Davis, Executive Vice President and Chief Administrative and Information Officer
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Brady K. Long, Senior Vice President and General Counsel
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For purposes of this Compensation Discussion and Analysis, the term Executive Officer is as defined by Rule 3b-7 of the Exchange Act, and the term Executive Management Team refers to designations made by the Board of Directors under Swiss law and the Companys organizational documents with respect to Messrs. Thigpen, Mey and Stobart.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Summary
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive compensation program reflects our commitment to best practices in compensation governance and strongly aligning pay with Company performance while allowing us to attract and retain highly qualified executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The program is designed to motivate our executives to achieve important business objectives and to reward them for creating long-term value for our shareholders by delivering superior financial, safety and operational performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe our executive compensation program includes features that effectively align the interests of our senior management with those of our shareholders and excludes features that may result in misalignment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Important features of our executive compensation programs and practices are provided in the following table:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What We Do   What We Dont Do  Conduct an annual review of our compensation strategy, including a review of our compensation- related risk profile   Allow our executives to hedge, sell short or hold derivative instruments tied to our shares (other than options issued by us)  Mandate meaningful share ownership requirements for our executives   Allow our executives or directors to pledge Company shares  Maintain a clawback policy that allows for the forfeiture, recovery or adjustment of incentive compensation paid to executives due to a material misstatement of financial results   Have pre-arranged individual severance agreements or  special  change-in-control  compensation agreements with any Executive Officers; however, subject to the limitations under the Minder Ordinance pursuant to which severance cannot be paid to members of our Executive Management Team, our executives are eligible for severance and change-in-control  provisions  pursuant  to  our policies  Base annual and long-term incentive payments on quantitative metrics   Provide gross-ups for severance payments  Maintain compensation plans designed to align our executive compensation program with long-term shareholder interests   Guarantee salary increases, non-performance based bonuses or unrestricted equity compensation  Link long-term incentive compensation to relative performance metrics   Provide any payments or reimbursements for tax equalization  Deliver at least 50% of long-term incentives in performance-based equity awards   Pay dividend equivalents on performance units that have not been earned  Retain an independent consultant that does not perform any services for management (i.e., retained by and reports to our Compensation Committee)   Offer executive perquisites, effective January 1, 2017  Maintain double trigger change-in-control provisions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 Business Overview
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result of our strong revenue efficiency performance, continued progress on margin improvement initiatives, as well as our liquidity accomplishments, Transocean outperformed the peer group in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These actions demonstrate the direct correlation between operational performance and shareholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 Relative Stock Performance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Peers include: ATW, DO, ESV, NE, ORIG, PACD, RDC, SDRL
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Transocean is a leading international provider of offshore contract drilling services for oil and gas wells.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company specializes in technically demanding sectors of the global offshore drilling business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With a particular focus on deepwater and harsh-environment drilling services, Transocean operates one of the most versatile offshore drilling fleets in the world.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of February 9, 2017, Transocean owns, or has partial ownership interests in, and operates a fleet of 56 mobile offshore drilling units consisting of 30 ultra-deepwater floaters, seven harsh-environment semisubmersibles, three deepwater semisubmersibles, six midwater semisubmersibles, and 10 high-specification jackups.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Company has four ultra-deepwater drillships and five high-specification jackups under construction or under contract to be constructed.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Despite oil prices falling to below U.S. $30/bbl during the first quarter of 2016, resulting in the further curtailing of customer spending, and the early termination of a number of drilling contracts, our 2016 financial results again exceeded expectations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are pleased that our continued commitment to operational excellence, and our intense focus on organizational and operational efficiency, resulted in another strong year for Transocean.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Recently, we have been encouraged by the improvement in both oil prices and sentiment; however, we fully anticipate that the offshore drilling market will continue to prove challenging in 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The combination of fewer contract roll-overs and limited visibility for new demand, will hinder, in the near-term, the meaningful advancement of both utilization and dayrates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In response, the Company continues to take the necessary actions to maintain our market leadership position, as well as to strategically position the Company to emerge from the downturn stronger.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As illustrated in the chart below, the equity market valuations of offshore drillers reflect these adverse market conditions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Relative Performance of Crude Oil; Offshore Drillers; OSX Index
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Offshore drillers include: RIG, ATW, DO, ESV, NE, ORIG PACD, RDC, SDRL
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, we continued to strengthen our liquidity and balance sheet, executing multiple financing transactions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, we issued approximately U.S. $2.5 billion of debt maturing in 2023 and 2024, while retiring U.S. $2.3 billion of debt with maturities between 2016 and 2022.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company further deferred the delivery of two ultra-deepwater drillships and five high-specification jackups into 2020, which delayed approximately U.S. $2 billion of shipyard payments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also acquired the outstanding interest in Transocean Partners, eliminating administrative costs and a significant quarterly cash distribution.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These actions, along with U.S. $3.1 billion of cash as of December 31, 2016, and a U.S. $3 billion undrawn, unsecured revolving credit facility, provide protection in the event of a protracted downturn, and preserve strategic optionality and shareholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We executed several new contracts during 2016, adding approximately U.S. $520 million in contract backlog.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Transoceans willingness to consider a performance driven model, and other flexible contract arrangements, assisted in the Company being awarded approximately one third of the annual contracted global floater fixtures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of February 9, 2017, our backlog totaled U.S. $11.3 billion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We delivered another year of strong operating results in 2016 guided by our continued commitment to streamlining and optimizing every aspect of our business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our operating strategy led to strong revenue efficiency results for 2016 of 97.8%, up from 96.0% in 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During 2016, we added three new contract-backed, ultra-deepwater drillships to our fleet: Deepwater Thalassa, Deepwater Proteus, and Deepwater Conqueror.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Both the Deepwater Thalassa and Deepwater Proteus have 10 year contracts with Shell in the U.S. Gulf of Mexico, and the Deepwater Conqueror has a five year contract with Chevron, also in the U.S. Gulf of Mexico.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We continued to drive year-over-year improvements in our safety performance in 2016 delivering a Total Recordable Incident Rate of 0.34, the best in the Companys history.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Given our long history as an industry-leading provider of offshore drilling services, we believe that we have the experience and financial discipline necessary to effectively manage our business throughout the cycles and deliver long-term value to our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Relationship Between Target and Realizable Pay
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consistent with our philosophy of aligning the interests of our Executive Officers with those of our shareholders by basing the majority of compensation on achieving desired performance outcomes, the actual total compensation values received by our Executive Officers, in recent years, have ranged from below to above targeted and competitive market levels.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Below-target results have been driven by the lack of appreciation in the Companys share price and below-target total shareholder return relative to our peers, whereas more recent above-target results reflect our disciplined approach to the market downturn and our recent outperformance of competitors in the offshore drilling sector.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Summary Compensation Table reflects the grant-date fair value for share awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, we believe that realizable pay provides a better picture of the amounts actually earned.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In particular, we note that there have been no payouts under our performance-based unit program over the last six performance cycles, and all outstanding stock options are currently underwater.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The more recent, in-process long-term performance cycles, however, reflect our superior performance relative to offshore drilling peers, although these performance cycles remain at risk until their conclusion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The graph below illustrates the effect of our performance-based compensation programs on the total compensation of our Chief Executive Officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (1) Realized/realizable pay is defined as the compensation delivered or deliverable for each year calculated as of the end of the fiscal year, including: salary received, amounts actually paid under the annual incentive plan, payouts received under the performance unit plan (PSU) or, for performance periods still in progress, amounts that would be receivable if the PSU performance period ended 12/31/2016, the intrinsic (in-the-money) value of the stock options granted in the applicable year, and the value of time-based restricted share units (RSUs).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (2) For Steven Newman, our former Chief Executive Officer, the value of 2013 and 2014 RSUs were calculated as of 5/31/2015, the date of his separation from Transocean.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For Mr. Thigpen, the value of RSUs was calculated as of 12/30/2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (3) Mr. Newman received a pro-rata portion of PSUs (pro-rated based on his separation date).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (4) Figures for Mr. Thigpen for 2015 (hired in April, 2015) represent partial  year base pay and annual bonus target and exclude cash sign-on award and replacement RSU award in consideration of forfeited equity awards from his previous employer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 Compensation Program Overview
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company continued to reinforce the alignment between pay and performance with our executive compensation programs and compensation award levels for 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In recognition of the continuing global industry downturn, the Compensation Committee gave prudent consideration in developing target 2016 compensation opportunities for our Named Executive Officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Working closely with our independent compensation consultant, the following executive compensation actions were implemented for our Named Executive Officers:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Freeze on base salaries for all executives for 2016 (as was the case in 2015).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Further, base salaries have been again frozen for 2017;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Freeze on target annual incentive opportunities for all of our Executive Officers for 2016 (as was the case in 2015).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Further, targets have been again frozen for 2017;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Implemented cap on 2016-2018 performance award upside payout tied to declining absolute total shareholder return (TSR) performance; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Abolished all executive perquisites, including financial planning, annual physicals and club memberships, effective January 1, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These compensation actions reflect the continued downturn in the current market, while maintaining prudently designed, competitive compensation packages for our Named Executive Officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Compensation Philosophy, Strategy and Design
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The objective of our compensation program is to align pay with performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The program is designed to attract, motivate and retain superior executive talent in the geographic locations necessary to support our global operations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The program is also designed to provide our executives with a competitive compensation package that rewards performance against specific, identified financial, strategic and operational goals that the Compensation Committee believes are critical to the Companys long-term success and the achievement of sustainable long-term total returns to our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In designing our executive compensation program, we are guided by the following principal objectives
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: positioning elements of total direct compensation, in the aggregate for our executive team, at approximately the median of our peer companies;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: aligning annual incentive compensation with financial and strategic objectives; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: rewarding absolute share price appreciation and relative performance in TSR through long-term equity incentive awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We deliver the vast majority of executive pay as performance-based, at-risk incentive compensation, which is designed to balance short-term periodic results and long-term multi-year success of the Company and to build long- term shareholder value without excessive risk-taking.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe the approach achieves our objective of aligning pay and performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Compensation Setting
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that our executive compensation program must be regularly reviewed to ensure that we provide the opportunity for each of our Named Executive Officers to receive competitive compensation without providing an incentive for excessive risk-taking.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee annually reviews the total compensation and each component of compensation that may be paid or awarded to each of our Named Executive Officers and compares the total compensation and each component of compensation:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: externally against the amounts paid to Executive Officers holding comparable positions at companies with which we compete for executive talent; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: internally for purposes of ensuring internal equity and taking individual performance, skills, and experience into account.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We assess our compensation programs to ensure they are appropriately aligned with our industry sector and among companies in other industries of comparable size, international scope and organizational complexity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also seek to provide a direct link between pay and enhancing shareholder value and achieving our vision and business strategy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee employs two peer groups for setting executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Peer Group is used to assess the competitiveness of the compensation of our Named Executive Officers, and the Performance Peer Group is used to evaluate the relative total shareholder return performance of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Peer Group
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We compete for executive talent across many different sectors around the world.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, our primary competitive market generally includes other companies in the energy industry (oil and gas companies, offshore drilling companies and other energy services companies).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In making compensation decisions, for the Named Executive Officers, each element of their total direct compensation is compared against published and publicly available compensation data.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Peer Group for 2016 comprised the following companies:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Anadarko Petroleum Corporation Diamond Offshore Drilling, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: National Oilwell Varco, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Apache Corporation Encana Corporation Noble Corporation plc Baker Hughes Incorporated Ensco plc Noble Energy, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During 2016, three companies (BG Group plc, Cameron International Corporation and Talisman Energy Inc.) fell out of this Compensation Peer Group due to corporate acquisitions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, we consider the compensation practices of non-energy general industry peers of comparable size and international scope in setting executive compensation levels and use general industry data as a secondary market reference.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These non-energy general industry peers are expected to vary from year-to-year based on changes in the marketplace and the availability of published survey data for companies that meet the defined size, international scope and organizational structure criteria.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our target market position is determined based on the data believed to be most relevant for a given position.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For example, the Compensation Peer Group data are weighted more heavily for operations roles, whereas general industry data are weighted more heavily for executives overseeing corporate functions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, in accordance with our pay-for-performance philosophy, the Compensation Peer Group data is the primary reference for assessing short- term and long-term incentive compensation levels.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance Peer Group
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee establishes the Performance Peer Group in order to evaluate the Companys total shareholder return relative to that of companies considered to be direct business competitors and competitors for investment capital.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Beginning in 2016, the Compensation Committee refined the Performance Peer Group to focus on drillers to better align with our strategic business objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While the competition for executive talent spans a broader market as defined above in the section addressing the Compensation Peer Group, our Performance Peer Group is specific to those companies with expertise in technically demanding offshore drilling operations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Compensation Components
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive compensation program is designed to meet the objectives of our pay for performance philosophy by linking a significant portion of each executives compensation to Company and individual performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following table summarizes the purpose and key characteristics of each of the primary components of our executive compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Element      Purpose      Key Characteristics Base Salary   Provide a base level of income, targeting  the  market  median  for executive  talent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Individual circumstances may result in certain positions above or below market median.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Fixed  compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Reviewed annually and adjusted as appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual Cash Bonus   Motivate executives to achieve our short-term business objectives and reward  contributions  toward  the achievement  of  pre-established performance goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Variable  compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based  on corporate performance compared to pre- established performance goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Award potential ranges from 0% to 200% of target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Long-Term Incentive - Performance Units   Align the interests of our executives with those of our shareholders by creating a direct correlation of realized pay to key value drivers and increased shareholder  return  relative  to performance peers over the long term.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Variable compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The number of earned  units  is  based  on  total shareholder  return  relative  to performance of drilling industry peers during three-year performance periods.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Earned units can range from 0% to 200% of target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Long-Term Incentive - Restricted Share Units   Motivate executives to contribute to long-term increases in shareholder value, build executive ownership and retain executives through multi-year vesting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Variable  compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Long-term award  with  ratable  vesting  over three years that provides a direct correlation  of  realized  pay  to shareholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Long-Term Incentive - Non-Qualified Stock Options   Motivate executives to contribute to long-term increases in shareholder value, build executive ownership and retain executives through multi-year vesting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Variable  compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Long-term award  with  ratable  vesting  over three years that provides a direct link to stock price appreciation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Expatriate Benefits   Assist expatriate executives with part of the additional burden of an overseas posting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Fixed  compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Provided  to expatriate executives to assist with living  expenses  (e.g.,  housing, dependent education, cost of living differentials  and  automobile allowances).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other Compensation   Provide  benefits  that  promote employee health and welfare and assist executives in carrying out their duties and increasing productivity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Indirect  compensation  elements consisting of health and welfare plans and minimal perquisites.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Post-Employment   Retain executives by providing a measure of financial security in the event an executives employment is terminated without cause.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Fixed  compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Severance benefits, to the extent permissible under Swiss law, are provided pursuant to the Executive Severance Policy and are not payable in the event of a termination for cause or a voluntary resignation without good reason.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In assessing the reasonableness of the total direct compensation of the Named Executive Officers, particularly the compensation of our Chief Executive Officer, the Compensation Committee considered the amount and mix of compensation provided as a direct link to creating sustainable long-term shareholder value, achieving our vision and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: business strategy, and advancing the core principles of our compensation philosophy and objectives without excessive risk.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Base Salary
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Named Executive Officers receive base salaries constituting a basic level of compensation for services rendered during the year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The base salaries of our Named Executive Officers are determined by the Compensation Committee upon each officers initial hire and reviewed in connection with a promotion or other change in job responsibility.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each base salary is also reviewed by the Compensation Committee annually thereafter, both individually and, for internal pay equity purposes, relative to other Executive Officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Base salary adjustments are made to reflect our desired position in the competitive market.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of its base salary review, the Compensation Committee considers input from our Chief Executive Officer (except with respect to his own compensation), competitive compensation from our Peer Group and other survey data, job responsibilities, individual performance, and expected future contributions of each Named Executive Officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee also considers input from its compensation consultant as well as the Companys compensation philosophy and objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In February 2016, the Compensation Committee, in consideration of the current market downturn, and with consultation from its external compensation consultant, elected to freeze base salaries for Named Executive Officers, resulting in no 2016 increases over the 2015 base salaries.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Further, in February 2017, the Compensation Committee again elected to freeze base salaries in consideration of the continuing market downturn, resulting in no increases over the 2016 base salaries noted below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following base salaries in U.S. dollars were approved by the Committee for the individuals listed below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive      2016 Base Salary      Increase over 2015   Mr. Thigpen   1,000,000     0%   Mr. Mey   760,000     0%   Mr. Stobart   670,000     0%   Mr. Davis   550,000     0%   Mr. Long   525,000     0%

sentences.text: Annual Performance Bonus
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Performance Award and Cash Bonus Plan (the Bonus Plan) is a goal-driven plan that provides participants, including the Named Executive Officers, the opportunity to earn annual cash bonuses based on performance as measured against predetermined performance objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Individual target award levels, expressed as percentages of the participants base salaries, are established by the Compensation Committee at the beginning of the year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The target award opportunities under the Bonus Plan, when combined with base salaries, are intended to position the participants, on average, to earn total cash compensation approximating competitive market median levels.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance above and below the target provides the opportunity for participants to earn total annual cash compensation above the competitive market median, when warranted, by above-target performance, up to a designated maximum; or, the possibility of earning total annual cash compensation below the median for below-target performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the Bonus Plan for 2016, each Named Executive Officer had a potential payout range of 0% to 200% of his individual target award opportunity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee established a 2016 target bonus opportunity for each of the following Named Executive Officers at the same target opportunity as established for 2015, and have further maintained the same target bonus opportunities again in 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2016 target bonus opportunity for each Named Executive Officer, expressed as a percentage of base salary, is as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive      Bonus Target Mr. Thigpen   120%  Mr. Mey   85%  Mr. Stobart   100%  Mr. Davis   75%  Mr. Long   70%
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 Bonus Structure
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The annual cash bonus structure is designed with a focus on financial, operational and safety performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These three focus areas have a direct line of sight to annual company operational and financial results while maintaining a strong focus on personnel, industrial and environmental safety.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During the current drilling sector down cycle, driven largely by commodity pricing beyond the Companys control, this annual bonus structure is designed to focus on those areas where the Company can differentiate itself from our competitors and be well-positioned for the market recovery.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The design of each measure, relative weighting, and construction of our threshold-target-maximum payout range, were derived from the Companys 2016 business plan with a focus on continuous improvement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee considered the results of key performance areas, specified at the beginning of 2016, when determining the outcomes of the variable, performance-based compensation under the Performance Award and Cash Bonus Plan for our Named Executive Officers for 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each of the following performance areas is measured with a potential payout ranging from 0% to 200% achievement and is discussed in greater detail below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance Measures     Weighting  SAFETY   25%   Total Recordable Incident Rate (10%)     Operational Integrity / Process Safety (10%)     Dropped Object Potential Severity ( 5%)     UPTIME   25%    EBITDA   50%
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Safety Performance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our business involves numerous operating hazards, and we are strongly committed to protecting our employees, our property and the environment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our ultimate goal is expressed in our safety vision of an incident-free workplace all the time, everywhere.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The safety performance targets for 2016 were approved by the Compensation Committee and levels are set annually to motivate our executives to achieve continuous improvement in safety performance and to meet strict internal standards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Safety performance targets are recommended to the Compensation Committee by the Boards Health Safety and Environment Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, the Compensation Committee measured our safety performance through a combination of components: Total Recordable Incident Rate (TRIR), Dropped Object Potential Severity (DPSR) and Operational Integrity (also referred to as Process Safety).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TRIR and Process Safety were each weighted at 10%, with DPSR weighted at 5%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following charts show our actual performance related to the formulaic payout amounts for TRIR, DPSR and Operational Integrity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During 2016, performance results across all three safety measures established new company records.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These results reflect an outstanding commitment to safety from our workforce and a relentless focus on continuous improvement toward an incident-free workplace.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Together, the safety metric outcomes resulted in a formulaic payout percentage for Safety of 42% of the total target bonus opportunity for each of the Named Executive Officers in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Total Recordable Incident Rate (TRIR)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TRIR is a safety performance metric recognized by the U.S. Occupational Safety & Health Administration and is used by companies across an array of industries.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We calculate TRIR based upon the guidelines set forth by the International Association of Drilling Contractors (the IADC), an industry group for the drilling industry.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The IADC methodology calculates TRIR by taking the aggregate number of occurrences of work-related injuries or illnesses that result in any of the following: death; a physician or licensed health care professional recommending days away from work due to the injury or illness; an employee not being able to perform all of his or her routine job functions (but not resulting in days away from work); or any other medical care or treatment beyond minor first aid.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The TRIR is the number of such occurrences for every 200,000 employee hours worked.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee approved a TRIR target for 2016 of 0.39, representing further progress toward our zero accident safety vision.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This target represented an improvement of 8% over the 2015 actual performance which represented the best TRIR outcome to that point in the Companys history.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Values above and below this target were calculated in accordance with the chart below, with outcomes falling between the two boundaries interpolated on a straight-line basis:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TRIR Outcome to Target      Bonus Payout   Maximum = 0.35   200%     Target = 0.39   100%     Minimum = 0.47   0%
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any TRIR outcome representing a result of 0.47 or greater would result in a 0% bonus payout for the TRIR metric, representing a 20% negative variance from target; however, if 2016 results did not outperform 2015 actual performance, a 10% reduction would be applied to the formulaic payout for the TRIR component.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TRIR results of 0.35, reflecting top quartile IADC performance, would result in a payout of 200% for the TRIR metric.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our TRIR outcome for 2016 was 0.34, exceeding maximum performance as compared to target and represents the best TRIR result in the Companys history.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This resulted in a formulaic result of 200% of target for the TRIR metric and a formulaic result for this measure of 20% of the total target bonus opportunity for each of the Named Executive Officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dropped Object Potential Severity (DPSR)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: DPSR is an internally developed safety measure that we utilize to capture the potential severity of incidents over a period of time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This 2016 safety measure represents a focus on continuous improvement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2015, the Company measured Total Potential Severity Rate, of which DPSR represented a significant component.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dropped objects from elevated heights, including tools, parts and equipment, have the potential to cause severe personnel injury and significant structural damage to the rig.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Analysis indicated dropped object incidents typically have the highest potential severity to harm people working onboard our rigs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As such, we extracted this metric from TPSR in order to bring a more acute focus to dropped object prevention.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, the bonus measure reflects our focus on accident avoidance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The formulaic measure of DPSR evaluates the severity of all dropped objects and applies a score to each incident based on severity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This severity assessment follows prescribed guidelines defined in the Companys Health and Safety Policies and Requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The sum of dropped object events is then measured against the total number of working hours, to determine the quantity and severity of events as a factor of total hours worked.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This measurement technique, using total hours worked, is consistent with the methodology employed by OSHA and IADC in measuring work-related injuries.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee approved a DPSR target for 2016 of 9.93, reflecting a 9% improvement over our 2015 target and represents further progress toward our safety vision.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Values above and below this target were calculated in accordance with the chart below, with outcomes falling between two boundaries interpolated on a straight-line basis:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: DPSR Outcome to Target     Bonus Payout   20% Improvement Exceeding Target   200%     10% Improvement Exceeding Target   150%     Target   100%     10% Shortfall   50%     20% Shortfall   0%
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any DPSR outcome representing a shortfall of more than 20% as compared to the target would result in a 0% bonus payout for the DPSR metric and any outcome representing an improvement of 20% or greater as compared to the target would result in a payout of 200% for the DPSR metric.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our DPSR outcome for 2016 of 8.33 represents the best performance in the Companys history and a significant improvement as compared to the target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This improvement resulted in a formulaic result of 180.4% of target for the DPSR metric, and a formulaic result for this measure of 9% of the total target bonus opportunity for each of the Named Executive Officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Operational Integrity (Process Safety)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that in addition to personnel and behavioral safety, prevention and mitigation of major accident hazards or process incidents are critical components of a comprehensive safety management program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, Operational Integrity is an internally developed safety measure designed to prevent or mitigate a major accident or significant event.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We use industry standard definitions of significant events, which include:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Fire, explosion, release of a hazardous substance with serious injury or fatality
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Major structural damage
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Serious injuries/fatalities
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Uncontrolled release of hazardous fluids
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To implement this Operational Integrity metric, we measure the number of process safety events that are likely predictors or leading indicators of a potentially significant major accident hazard event.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2016 target for process safety events was established to represent an improvement over the baseline of events that occurred on our installations in 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee approved an Operational Integrity target for 2016 of 0.42, reflecting improvement over 2015 actual results of 0.44 and representing further progress toward our safety vision.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Values above and below this target were calculated in accordance with the chart below, with outcomes falling between two boundaries interpolated on a straight-line basis:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Operational Integrity Outcome to Target     Bonus Payout   20% Improvement Exceeding Target   200%     10% Improvement Exceeding Target   150%     Target   100%     10% Shortfall   50%     20% Shortfall   0%
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, the Operational Integrity measure realized an actual result of 0.09, resulting in 200% achievement of this metric and a formulaic result for this measure of 20%; however, the Operational Integrity measure calls for a one-third reduction in the formulaic payout result in the event of any Tier1 Operational Integrity event, as defined in the Companys Health and Safety Policies and Requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A Tier1 event is the most serious Operational Integrity event, requiring immediate and potentially significant company time and resources to rectify.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In August 2016, Transocean experienced a Tier1 Operational Integrity event that resulted in a reduction of the formulaic result for the Operational Integrity measure from 20% to 13.33% of the total bonus opportunity for each of the Named Executive Officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During severe weather on August 8, 2016, the tow to the Transocean Winner was lost and the rig subsequently grounded off the Western Isles of Scotland.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Transocean personnel were immediately mobilized to recover the rig and mitigate impact.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Financial Performance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: EBITDA
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the 2016 bonus plan, the Compensation Committee determined Earnings Before Interest, Taxes, Depreciation and Amortization (EBITDA), a commonly accepted measure of financial performance, as the most appropriate measure to align with the Companys financial objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Weighted at 50% of the total 2016 annual bonus plan opportunity, EBITDA replaces the prior 2015 bonus plan focus on Cash Flow Value Added and Operating Costs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Attached as Appendix A to this proxy statement is a reconciliation of EBITDA, a non-GAAP financial measure, to net income, the most directly comparable GAAP financial measure.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe this move to EBITDA is a more holistic view of the Companys financial performance in current market conditions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The measure reflects the complete revenue and cost cycle in our business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: EBITDA is an objective performance measure commonly used among our drilling company peers and is a financial indicator transparent and familiar to our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In establishing the EBITDA target, the Compensation Committee considered the Companys 2016 financial plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Threshold and maximum performance outcomes were then set based on the potential for decreases or increases to financial outcomes tied to dynamic market conditions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: EBITDA Target      Achievement (MM-$) Threshold   1,540    Target   1,876    Maximum   2,049
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 EBITDA results were challenged by declining demand for rigs combined with depressed dayrates for contracts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, a strong focus on cost management combined with outstanding efficiency for deployed rigs, resulted in actual EBITDA results exceeding the target for this measure.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: EBITDA results achieved 161.3% of target, and a formulaic result for this measure of 80.64% of the total target bonus opportunity for each of the Named Executive Officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The EBITDA achievement that was applied to the annual bonus plan performance achievement was adjusted downward to remove certain revenue associated with early contract terminations and other unanticipated events during the performance cycle; thus, EBITDA results applied to the annual bonus plan are lower than the financial results recorded in the Companys financial statements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Without such downward adjustments to the bonus plan EBITDA results, actual bonus results would have been higher, potentially leading to the unintended consequence of higher incentive awards due to lower rig activity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Uptime
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Uptime was identified as the operational performance measure that would best align with our customers interests during 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This measure represented 25% of the total target annual bonus opportunity to reinforce the importance of maintaining excellence in rig operations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While similar to Revenue Efficiency, a drilling rigs measure of contract revenues used in the Companys 2015 annual bonus plan, Uptime has a more direct focus on operational efficiency.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Uptime is a common operational metric used in the drilling industry; however, there is no standard industry definition and reporting structure for this metric.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Companys definition recognizes both equipment failures and human performance errors in calculating a rigs performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Uptime is measured as operating hours, minus downtime, expressed as a percentage.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Operating hours are defined as the number of hours a rig is engaged in a contract.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Downtime is defined as the number of hours the rig is not engaged in drilling activities, resulting from mechanical failure or human performance error.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Using this formula, zero mechanical failures and human performance errors would result in the rig operating at 100% Uptime.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Downtime events detract from optimal performance and have a direct negative impact on the customers operational plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In setting the threshold-target-maximum range for this measure, the mathematical differential across the range may appear small (e.g., a 1.5% spread from target to maximum performance); however, this differential is significant considering the total number of operating hours during a calendar year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee approved the following Uptime target for 2016:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Uptime Target      Achievement   Threshold   94.0%     Target   95.5%     Maximum   97.0%
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In setting the 2016 performance range, management considered past performance and set stretch targets to focus on continuous improvement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While the Company strives for improvement year over year, consideration must be given to the Companys fleet composition and business cycle in setting this target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Reduced fleet size, shorter contract durations, change of location mobilizations and the challenge of bringing new rigs on line will all potentially apply downward pressure on a fleets Uptime performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We experienced all of these challenges in 2016 and still delivered outstanding Uptime performance for our customers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on this high level of operational efficiency, the actual Uptime measure achieved 96.6%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This incremental 1.1% above target performance, equates to approximately 3,300 hours, or 137.5 days, of additional operational productivity across the fleet.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This achievement result represents 173.3% of target, and a formulaic result for this measure of 43.33% of the total target bonus opportunity for each of the Named Executive Officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN
