sentences.text: Long-Term Incentives
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We establish competitive long-term incentive (LTI) opportunities for our Named Executive Officers that motivate achievement of long-term operational goals and increased total shareholder return, align the interests of participants with those of shareholders and vary in the ultimate actual value of the awards based on the Companys actual total shareholder return and share price performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To provide an appropriate balance of incentives tied to performance, three types of long-term equity instruments were used in 2016, including Performance Units, Restricted Share Units and Non-Qualified Stock Options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The weighting of each instrument in our long-term incentive program was as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This long-term incentive mix is designed to ensure a minimum of 50% of the total weighting is applied to the Performance Units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock Options are included in the incentive mix to reinforce a direct relationship to the shareholder experience.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock Options only deliver value to the executive when the Companys share price exceeds the strike price on the option.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All three equity instruments are also designed to be retentive in nature through multi- year performance periods and vesting periods.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The forms of equity awards made to our Named Executive Officers are discussed in greater detail below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 LTI Grant Value  U.S.$      2015 LTI Grant Value U.S.$ Mr. Thigpen   5,250,000     5,500,000    Mr. Mey   2,200,000     2,200,000    Mr. Stobart   2,210,000     1,880,000    Mr. Davis   1,650,000        Mr. Long   1,312,500
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ()    Messrs. Davis and Long were hired in 2015 and did not receive a target annual equity award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance Units (PSU)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each PSU represents one share and is earned based on performance over a three-year performance cycle from January 1, 2016 through December 31, 2018.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance is determined by comparing the Companys TSR performance relative to the Companys Performance Peer Group over the three-year performance cycle.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In constructing this performance equity plan, the Compensation Committee considered the value of including an absolute financial measure, similar to the structure of the Companys 2015  2018 performance plan which included Return on Capital Employed (ROCE) as a financial measure.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: After a thorough review of current market conditions and the substantial challenges in setting ROCE long-term incentive goals in an extremely volatile environment, the Committee concluded that a single measure of relative TSR using the Performance Peer Group of nine offshore drillers offered the best shareholder alignment and better supported the Companys strategic objective of becoming the undisputed leader in offshore drilling.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In further recognition of the importance of shareholder alignment, the Compensation Committee capped the earning of Performance Units at target if the Companys absolute TSR during a performance period is less than -15%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We set the cap at a level of -15% to ensure that management does not benefit disproportionately from shareholder returns that are more than marginally negative.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Actual results at the completion of the three-year performance cycle will be determined by the following ordinal ranking of TSR performance:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Company Ranking      % of Target  Performance Units 1   200% 2   175% 3   150% 4   125% 5   100% 6   83% 7   67% 8   50% 9   0% 10   0%
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Upon completion of the 2016 - 2018 PSU performance cycle, the Compensation Committee will determine final payout levels, and PSUs will be distributed to the Named Executive Officer, along with a cash payment equal to any dividends or equivalents accrued during the performance cycle for earned and vested shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Restricted Share Units
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The target value of the 2016 RSU grants to each of the Named Executive Officers was approximately one- quarter (25%) of each officers total 2016 long-term incentive award target value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Time-vested RSUs were granted to all Named Executive Officers as part of the 2016 annual long-term incentive grants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each RSU represents one share and vests over a three-year schedule (ratably one-third each year), contingent on continued service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Non-Qualified Stock Options
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The target value of the 2016 Non-Qualified Stock Options (NQSO) grants to each of the Named Executive Officers was approximately one-quarter (25%) of each officers total 2016 long-term incentive award target value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Time-vested NQSOs were granted to all Named Executive Officers as part of the 2016 annual long-term incentive grants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each NQSO represents one share and vests over a three-year schedule (ratably one-third each year), contingent on continued service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Realized Long-Term Incentive Compensation for 2016
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2017, the Compensation Committee evaluated the Companys performance for the three-year performance period from January 1, 2014 through December 31, 2016, and determined the Companys performance to be 123.3% of target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This result represents the first payout in seven performance cycles for the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This performance plan consisted of two measures, equally weighted at 50% of the total award opportunity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The two measures included relative TSR as measured against a performance peer group, and ROCE during the first year of the three year performance cycle.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Final measurement for this performance cycle included ROCE results slightly below maximum performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Actual ROCE financial results are not disclosed due to the proprietary nature of this information in establishing the Companys competitive position in the market.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With respect to relative TSR, the Company ranked 8 of 12 against performance peer companies, resulting in performance below target for this measure.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The two measures combined resulted in the 123.3% of target performance outcome.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Stobart is the only Named Executive Officer eligible for this 2014  2016 performance plan payout.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When considering the Companys share price decline during this three year period, however, the 123.3% achievement level translates to approximately 39% of target in realizable value compared to the expected target value at grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employment Agreements with Named Executive Officers
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employment agreements with our Executive Management Team comply with the Minder Ordinance, which prohibits the payment of severance benefits to members of the Executive Management Team.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other than the individual compensation terms applicable for each executive, the same basic form of employment agreement was used for Named Executive Officers with employment agreements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Expatriate Benefits
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For our Named Executive Officers who accept an international assignment, we also provide certain expatriate benefits, including housing, car, cost of living allowances and educational expenses for dependent children.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These benefits are designed to help defray the significant expense associated with expatriation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Beginning in 2014 the Named Executive Officers ceased to be eligible for tax protection or tax equalization on these expatriate benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Effective September 1, 2016, Mr. Stobart was the only Named Executive Officer receiving the above-mentioned expatriate benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The types and values of these benefits for each Named Executive Officer are included in the Summary Compensation Table under All Other Compensation and described in the notes to that table.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Indirect Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to base salary and annual and long-term incentive compensation, we offer other indirect compensatory arrangements to our executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These indirect elements of executive compensation are not performance-based and are offered as part of the overall compensation package to ensure that the package is competitive with other companies with which we compete for talent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Below is a summary of the principal indirect elements of compensation for our Named Executive Officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Health, Welfare and Retirement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Named Executive Officers are eligible for Company-wide benefits on substantially the same basis as other full-time employees, including savings, pension, medical and life insurance benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Named Executive Officers also receive a supplemental life insurance benefit equal to four times covered annual earnings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For Named Executive Officers on the U.S. payroll, this benefit is capped at a maximum of U.S. $1 million.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, we make a supplemental pension plan available to employees (including the Named Executive Officers) to compensate for benefits that otherwise would be unavailable due to U.S. Internal Revenue Service limits on qualified plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Perquisites
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, the Compensation Committee elected to eliminate all executive perquisites for our Named Executive Officers, effective January 1, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to elimination, the Company offered limited perquisites as a recruiting and retention tool.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each of our Named Executive Officers could receive reimbursement of up to U.S. $5,000 in financial planning consulting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Named Executive Officers were also eligible to receive reimbursement for club membership dues and an annual physical exam paid by the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The amounts of these perquisites were taxable to the Named Executive Officers in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Post-Employment Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that the competitive marketplace for executive talent and our desire to retain our Executive Officers require us, subject to compliance with applicable law, to provide our Executive Officers with a severance package.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each of our Executive Officers who are not members of our Executive Management Team is eligible to receive severance benefits in the event we choose to terminate the Executive Officer at our convenience.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Currently, all Named Executive Officers who are not members of our Executive Management Team are covered under our executive severance benefit policy, which provides for specified payments and benefits in the event of a termination at our convenience.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The benefits provided in the event of an involuntary termination under the terms of our executive severance benefit policy include a cash severance benefit limited to 52 weeks of base salary; a pro rata share of the termination years award under the Bonus Plan for such executive, as determined by the Compensation Committee; treatment of long-term incentive awards under the convenience-of-company termination provision as provided for in the terms and conditions of each award (as more fully described under Executive CompensationPotential Payments Upon Termination or Change of Control); and outplacement services not to exceed 5% of the base salary of the executive.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also believe that the interests of our shareholders are served by including a double-trigger change-of- control provision in the Bonus Plan and the Long-Term Incentive Plan for Named Executive Officers who would be integral to the success of, and are most likely to be impacted by, a change of control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By requiring two triggering events to occur, we believe that those Executive Officers who remain with us through a change of control will be appropriately focused while those who depart as a result of a change of control will be appropriately compensated.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The types of payments that will be made to our executives, along with estimated values as of December 31, 2016, are described under Executive Compensation-Potential Payments Upon Termination or Change in Control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee periodically reviews severance packages offered to the Executive Officers to ensure the benefits are aligned with prevailing market practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In order for a Named Executive Officer to receive the benefits described above, the Named Executive Officer must first sign a release of all claims against the Company and enter into a non-competition and confidentiality agreement covering our trade secrets and proprietary information.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Minder Ordinance prohibits certain types of compensation payments to members of the Executive Management Team, including severance payments in any form.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Therefore, members of the Executive Management Team are not eligible to participate in the executive severance benefits policy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to their employment agreements, members of the Executive Management Team must receive at least twelve months notice prior to a termination of employment without cause.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Compensation Governance, Policy and Practice
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee is responsible for the executive compensation program design and decision- making process.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee solicits input from the independent members of the Board of Directors, the Chief Executive Officer and other members of management, and the independent compensation consultant to assist with its responsibilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following summarizes the roles of each of the key participants in the executive compensation decision-making process.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee, composed solely of members of the Board of Directors who
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) are not employees of the Company,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) meet the independence requirements of the NYSE, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) meet the qualifications of outside directors under Section 162(m) of the U.S. Internal Revenue Code, is responsible for overseeing our executive compensation and long-term incentive programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Specifically, the Compensation Committee is responsible for:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: reviewing and approving the target and actual compensation paid and the benefit levels received by our Executive Officers;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: annually recommending focus areas for our Chief Executive Officer for approval by the members of our Board of Directors who meet the independence and experience requirements set forth in the Compensation Committee charter, annually evaluating all aspects of our Chief Executive Officers performance in light of these focus areas (with the participation of all non-executive members of the Board of Directors), and setting our Chief Executive Officers compensation based on this evaluation and after reviewing data concerning compensation practices in the competitive market;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: establishing and approving our executive compensation plans and arrangements to provide benefits to our Executive Officers in accordance with the goals and objectives of the Company, as established by the Board of Directors;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: administering the Companys long-term incentive plans, including determining plan eligibility and approving individual awards for all plan participants;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: administering the Companys Performance Award and Cash Bonus plan and approving individual awards for all Executive Officers;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: considering and approving executive employment and, to the extent permissible under Swiss law, severance agreements or other contractual agreements that may be entered into with our Executive Officers (which shall not include single-trigger change-in-control agreements);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: reviewing and discussing this Compensation Discussion and Analysis, the Companys Swiss statutory compensation report and maximum aggregate compensation limits for the Board of Directors and members of the Executive Management Team with our management and, based upon such review and discussion, recommending to the Board of Directors that the Compensation Discussion and Analysis be included in the proxy statement for our Annual General Meeting or our annual report, as applicable; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: assessing the risks associated with the Companys compensation arrangements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee currently consists of four directors: Tan Ek Kia (Chairman), Frederico F. Curado, Vincent J. Intrieri and Martin B. McNamara.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Independent Compensation Consultant
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To assist in discharging its responsibilities, the Compensation Committee engaged an independent executive compensation consulting firm, Pay Governance LLC, which advised the Compensation Committee on executive compensation matters for 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In order not to impair the independence of the Compensation Committees compensation consultant or create the appearance of such an impairment, the Compensation Committee adopted a policy that any compensation consultant to the Compensation Committee may not provide other services to the Company in excess of U.S. $100,000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Neither Pay Governance nor any of its affiliates provided the Company with any other services in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In May 2016, the Compensation Committee assessed whether the work of Pay Governance for the Compensation Committee during 2016 raised any conflict of interest by conducting a review of a number of independence factors, which included the factors set forth under Rule 10C-1 of the Exchange Act.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee concluded that no conflict of interest was raised that would prevent Pay Governance from independently representing the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In advising the Compensation Committee, the compensation consultant reports to and acts at the direction of the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee directs the compensation consultant in the performance of its duties under its engagement to provide certain guidance on an ongoing basis, including:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: expertise on compensation strategy and program design;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: information relating to the selection of the Companys peer group;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: relevant market data and alternatives to consider when making compensation decisions;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: assistance in establishing and updating annual and long-term incentive guidelines;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: periodic reviews of the total executive compensation program; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: support and advice as the Compensation Committee conducts its analysis of and makes its decisions regarding executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee does not necessarily adopt all recommendations given by the compensation consultant but uses the consultants work as a reference in exercising its own judgment with respect to its own executive compensation actions and decisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The compensation consultant participates in every meeting of the Compensation Committee and meets privately with the Compensation Committee at the Compensation Committees request.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our management provides information to the consultant but does not direct or oversee its activities with respect to our executive compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other Advisors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: From time-to-time, management engages other advisors to assist in providing advice to the Compensation Committee, regarding executive compensation matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such advisors have included, among others, an outside law firm to provide advice regarding various legal issues, financial analysts to examine relevant performance metrics and an outside actuarial firm to evaluate benefits programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee evaluates these advisors for independence, when retained.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Chief Executive Officer annually reviews the competitive pay position and the performance of each member of senior management other than himself.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Chief Executive Officers conclusions and recommendations, including base salary adjustments and award amounts for the current year and target annual award amounts for the next year under our Performance Award and Cash Bonus Plan (other than for himself), are presented to the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee makes all compensation decisions and approves all share- based awards for the Named Executive Officers and other Executive Officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee may exercise its discretion in modifying any compensation adjustment or awards to any Executive Officer, including reducing or increasing the payment amount for one or more components of such awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Officers and other employees in our Human Resources Department assist our Chief Executive Officer with his recommendations and develop and present other recommendations regarding compensation to the Compensation Committee as needed.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our officers and other employees participate in Compensation Committee discussions in an informational and advisory capacity and have no authority in the Compensation Committees decision-making process.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additional Executive Compensation Information
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Use of Tally Sheets
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee reviews compensation tally sheets, prepared by management, that present comprehensive data on the total compensation and benefits package for each of our Named Executive Officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Tally sheets include all current compensation obligations, as well as additional analyses with respect to hypothetical terminations to consider the Companys obligations under such circumstances.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee does not use the tally sheets to determine the various elements of compensation or the actual amounts of compensation to be approved but, rather, to evaluate the Companys obligations under the various programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Share Ownership Guidelines for Executives
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe it is important for our Named Executive Officers to build and maintain an appropriate minimum equity stake in the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys share ownership guidelines for Named Executive Officers are intended to further align executives interests with the interests of our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under these guidelines, Named Executive Officers must retain 50% of any shares that vest (net of taxes due) until the ownership guidelines are met.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each of our Named Executive Officers must own an amount of shares equivalent to the following:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CEO      6x base pay Executive Vice President   3x base pay Senior Vice President   2x base pay Vice President   1x base pay
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compliance with this policy is reviewed by the Compensation Committee, and executives must certify their compliance on an annual basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee may exercise its discretion in response to any non- compliance of this policy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No Hedging of Company Shares
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have a policy that prohibits any of our Executive Officers and directors from holding derivative instruments tied to our shares, other than derivative instruments that may be granted by us (e.g., stock options).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Executive Officers and directors are prohibited from hedging, engaging in short sales and holding our shares in margin accounts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No Pledging of Company Shares
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have a policy that prohibits any of our Executive Officers and directors from pledging shares issued by
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Executive Officers and directors must certify compliance with the hedging and pledging provisions of our Insider Trading Policy on an annual basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Compensation Recoupment/Clawback Policy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the Incentive Compensation Recoupment Policy, the Company is authorized to recover or adjust incentive compensation to the extent the Compensation Committee determines that payments or awards have exceeded the amount that would otherwise have been received, due to a restatement of financial results or if the Compensation Committee determines that an executive has engaged in, or has knowledge of, and fails to prevent or disclose, fraud or intentional misconduct pertaining to any financial reporting requirement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee expects to update this policy if and when the SEC issues final rules on the recoupment of executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Tax Impact on Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To the extent attributable to our United States subsidiaries and otherwise deductible, Section 162(m) of the Internal Revenue Code (Section 162(m)) limits the tax deduction that United States subsidiaries can take with respect to the compensation of designated Executive Officers, unless the compensation is performance-based.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the long-term incentive plan, the Compensation Committee has the discretion to award performance- based cash compensation that qualifies under Section 162(m) based on the achievement of objective performance goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All Executive Officers are eligible to receive this type of award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee has determined, and may in the future determine, to award compensation that does not qualify under Section 162(m) as performance- based compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: COMPENSATION COMMITTEE REPORT
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee of the Board of Directors has reviewed and discussed the above Compensation Discussion and Analysis with management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on such review and discussions, the Compensation Committee recommended to the Companys Board of Directors that the above Compensation Discussion and Analysis be included in this proxy statement.

sentences.text: Transocean Savings Restoration Plan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company maintains the Transocean Savings Restoration Plan, a nonqualified, unfunded, defined contribution plan for key management employees who earn compensation in excess of certain limits in the Internal Revenue Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All Named Executive Officers participate in this plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Effective January 1, 2017, all participants in this plan are fully vested.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The plan provides that eligible participants receive an annual contribution equal to 10% (or such other percentage as determined by the administrative committee) of the compensation earned in a particular calendar year that is in excess of the Internal Revenue Code limits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation considered under this plan includes basic salary and annual performance bonus.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A participant must be employed on the last day of the calendar year in order to receive a contribution for a particular year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Transocean U.S. Retirement Plan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Transocean U.S. Retirement Plan is a tax-qualified pension plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Benefit accruals under this plan were frozen effective as of December 31, 2014.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Stobart is the only the Named Executive Officer who participates in this plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The purpose of the plan is to provide post-retirement income benefits to employees in recognition of their long-term service to the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Benefits available to executives are no greater than those offered to non-executive participants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The plan is funded through cash contributions made by the Company based on actuarial valuations and regulatory requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employees working for the Company in the U.S. are fully vested after completing five years of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: eligible employment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employees earn the right to receive a benefit upon retirement at the normal retirement age of 65 or upon early retirement (age 55 or older with five years of service).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The elements of compensation included in computing the retirement benefit are basic salary and annual performance bonuses earned prior to January 1, 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Retirement benefits are calculated as
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the sum of 1% of the employees compensation for each calendar year (or partial year)  of employment, divided by
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) twelve.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Certain assumptions and calculation methods were used to determine the values of the pension benefits disclosed in the Pension Benefits Table above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In particular, monthly accrued pension benefits, payable at age 65, were determined as of December 31, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The present value of these benefits was calculated based on assumptions used in the Companys financial statements for 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Transocean Pension Equalization Plan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Pension Equalization Plan (PEP) is a nonqualified, unfunded, noncontributory pension plan that was frozen effective December 31, 2014.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Stobart is the only Named Executive Officer with a frozen benefit in the PEP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Certain employees are eligible to receive a benefit under the PEP if the level of their compensation prior to January 1, 2015, would otherwise cause them to exceed the Internal Revenue Code compensation limitations imposed on the Transocean U.S. Retirement Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The purpose of the PEP is to provide supplemental post-retirement income in recognition of service to the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Benefits are payable upon a participants termination of employment, or six months after termination in the case of certain officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The plan recognizes the same forms of compensation and the same formula used to calculate the plan benefit as the Transocean U.S. Retirement Plan however, earnings are not limited to the pay cap under the Internal Revenue Code Section 401(a)(17) (U.S. $260,000 in 2014 when the PEP was frozen).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Benefits are not earned until the individual has five years of credited service with the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Certain assumptions and calculation methods were used to determine the values of the pension benefits disclosed in the Pension Benefits Table above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In particular, monthly accrued pension benefits, payable at age 65, were determined as of December 31, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The present value of these benefits was calculated based on assumptions used in the Companys financial statements for 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 16(a) Beneficial Ownership Reporting Compliance

sentences.text: Federal securities laws require the Companys Executive Officers and directors, and persons who own more than ten percent of the Companys shares, to file initial reports of ownership and reports of changes in ownership of the Companys equity securities with the Securities and Exchange Commission.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based solely on a review of such reports furnished to the Company and written representations that no report on Form 5 was required for 2016, the Company believes that no director, officer or beneficial owner of more than ten percent of the Companys shares failed to file a report on a timely basis in 2016 other than a Form 4 that was filed on behalf of Mr. Howard E. Davis, the Companys Executive Vice President, Chief Administrative Officer and Chief Information Officer, on November 16, 2016, with respect to the vesting of certain restricted units on August 17, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Householding
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The SEC permits us, under certain circumstances, to send a single set of the Notice of Internet Availability of Proxy Materials, proxy materials, and annual reports to any household at which two or more shareholders reside if they appear to be members of the same family.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This procedure, referred to as householding, reduces the volume of duplicate information shareholders receive and reduces mailing and printing expenses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In order to take advantage of this opportunity, we have delivered only one Notice of Internet Availability of Proxy Materials or, if you previously requested to receive paper proxy materials by mail, one proxy statement and annual report to shareholders who share an address (unless we received contrary instructions from the affected shareholders prior to the mailing date).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, if any such shareholder residing at such an address wishes to receive a separate copy of any of these documents either now or in the future, or if any such shareholder that elected to continue to receive separate copies wishes to receive a single copy in the future, that shareholder should send a request in writing to Investor Relations at our offices in the United States, at 4 Greenway Plaza, Houston, Texas 77046 or by calling +1 (713) 232-7500.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We will deliver, promptly upon written or oral request to Investor Relations, a separate copy of the proxy materials to a shareholder at a shared address to which a single copy of the documents was delivered.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A number of brokerage firms have instituted householding.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If your family or others with a shared address have one or more street name accounts under which you beneficially own shares, you may have received householding information from your broker/dealer, financial institution or other nominee in the past.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please contact the holder of record directly if you have questions, require additional copies of the proxy materials or wish to revoke your decision to household and thereby receive multiple copies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposals of Shareholders
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholder Proposals in the Proxy Statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Rule 14a-8 under the Exchange Act addresses when a company must include a shareholders proposal in its proxy statement and identify the proposal in its form of proxy when the company holds an annual or special meeting of shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under Rule 14a-8, in order for your proposals to be considered for inclusion in the proxy statement and proxy card relating to our 2018 Annual General Meeting, your proposals must be received at our principal executive offices c/o Transocean Management Ltd., 10 Chemin de Blandonnet, CH-1214 Vernier, Switzerland by no later than 5:00 p.m.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Swiss time on November 17,  2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, if the date of the 2018 Annual General Meeting changes by more than 30 days from the anniversary of the 2017 Annual General Meeting, the deadline is a reasonable time before we begin to print and mail our proxy materials.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We will notify you of this deadline in a Quarterly Report on Form 10-Q, in a Current Report on Form 8-K or in another communication to you.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholder proposals must also be otherwise eligible for inclusion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholder Proposals and Nominations for Directors to be Presented at Meetings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you desire to bring a matter before an annual general meeting and the proposal is submitted outside the process of Rule 14a-8, you must follow the procedures set forth in our Articles of Association.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Articles of Association provide generally that, if you desire to propose any business at an annual general meeting (including the nomination of any director), you must give us written notice at least 30 calendar days prior to the anniversary date of the proxy statement in connection with Transoceans last annual general meeting; provided, however, that if the date of the annual general meeting is 30 calendar days before or after the anniversary date of the last annual general meeting, such request must instead be made by the tenth day following the date on which we have made public disclosure of the date of the annual general meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The deadline under our Articles of Association for submitting proposals will be 5:00 p.m.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Swiss time on February 15,  2018, for the 2018 annual meeting unless it is more than 30 calendar days before or after May 11,  2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In order for the notice to be considered timely under Rule 14a-4(c) of the Exchange Act, proposals must be received no later than 5:00 p.m.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Swiss time on February 15,  2018.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The request must specify the relevant agenda items and motions, together with evidence of the required shareholdings recorded in the share register, as well as any other information required to be included in a proxy statement pursuant to the rules of the SEC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you desire to nominate directors to be presented at an annual general meeting, you must give us written notice within the time period described in the preceding paragraph.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you desire to nominate directors to be presented at an extraordinary general meeting at which the Board of Directors has determined that directors will be elected, you must give us written notice by the close of business on the tenth day following our public disclosure of the meeting date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Notice for the nomination of directors at any general meeting must set forth:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: your name and address and the name and address of the person or persons to be nominated;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: a representation that you are a holder of record of our shares entitled to vote at the meeting or, if the record date for the meeting is subsequent to the date required for that shareholder notice, a representation that you are a holder of record at the time of the notice and intend to be a holder of record on the date of the meeting and, in either case, setting forth the class and number of shares so held, including shares held beneficially;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: a representation that you intend to appear in person or by proxy as a holder of record at the meeting to nominate the person or persons specified in the notice;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: a description of all arrangements or understandings between you and each nominee you propose and any other person or persons under which the nomination or nominations are to be made by you;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: any other information regarding each nominee you propose that would be required to be included in a proxy statement filed pursuant to the proxy rules of the SEC; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the consent of each nominee to serve as a director if so elected.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors may refuse to transact any business or to acknowledge the nomination of any person  you fail to comply with the foregoing procedures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may obtain a copy of our Articles of Association and rganizational Regulations, in which these procedures are set forth, upon written request to our Corporate Secretary, ransocean Ltd., Turmstrasse 30, CH-6300 Zug, Switzerland.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cost of Solicitation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The accompanying proxy is being solicited on behalf of the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The expenses of preparing, printing and mailing the proxy and the materials used in the solicitation will be borne by us.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have retained D.F. King & Co., Inc. (New York) for a fee of U.S. $15,000, plus expenses, to aid in the solicitation of proxies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proxies may be solicited by personal interview, mail, telephone, facsimile, internet or other means of electronic distribution by our directors, officers and employees, who will not receive additional compensation for those services.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Arrangements also may be made with brokerage houses and other custodians, nominees and fiduciaries for the forwarding of solicitation materials to the beneficial owners of shares held by those persons, and we will reimburse them for reasonable expenses incurred by them in connection with the forwarding of solicitation materials.
